SENT.plain: We examined 5-hydroxytryptamine-like immunoreactive cerebrovascular nerve fibers in rats after experimental thromboembolic stroke

Although there were no visible 5-hydroxytryptamine-like immunoreactive nerve fibers in normal animals, we found many of these fibers near the clot emboli 30 min after the stroke, and the number of fibers increased slightly with time
In immunohistochemical double staining, these fibers corresponded to neuropeptide Y-like immunoreactive nerve fibers
And they were not observed in animals after superior cervical ganglionectomy
These findings suggest that the sympathetic nerves take up serotonin released from intraluminal aggregating platelets
